sanskrit_verse: संधिं छित्त्वा तु ये चौर्यं रात्रौ कुर्वन्ति तस्कराः । संधिं भित्त्वा तेषां छित्त्वा नृपो हस्तौ तीक्ष्णे शूले निवेशयेत् ॥ ९.२७६॥
transliteration: saṃdhiṃ chittvā tu ye cauryaṃ rātrau kurvanti taskarāḥ | saṃdhiṃ bhitvā teṣāṃ chittvā nṛpo hastau tīkṣṇe śūle niveśayet || 9.276 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who violate agreements and commit theft under cover of darkness shall have their hands pierced with sharp stakes by the ruler after severing the agreement.

supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that breaches of sworn agreements accompanied by covert criminal acts invoke a threshold of sovereign intervention. The court must ensure that authority is not misused but applied transparently where deliberate deception occurs. Responsibility lies at the level of conscious intent, not mere action.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals intentional violation through evidence of agreement-breaking and nighttime misconduct. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how untruth manifests step-by-step into disorder. Responsibility is proportional to awareness of wrongdoing. This consequence is not punitive; it serves as a visible marker for collective consciousness realignment.
